pl.elka.mkoi.math

Class BabyStepGiantStep

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.elka.mkoi.math.base.BigIntDiscreteLogarithm
      • pl.elka.mkoi.math.BabyStepGiantStep
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DiscreteLogarithm<java.math.BigInteger>

    public class BabyStepGiantStep
extends BigIntDiscreteLogarithm
    Class used to solve discrete algorithm problem using Baby Step - Giant Step algorithm.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class pl.elka.mkoi.math.base.BigIntDiscreteLogarithm

        MINUS_ONE, ONE, TWO, ZERO

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BabyStepGiantStep()
      EmptyConsoleLogger is used - no calculations will be logged on ConsolePanel
      BabyStepGiantStep(ConsoleLogger logger)
      Custom ConsoleLogger is used to log calculations on ConsolePanel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BabyStepGiantStep

        public BabyStepGiantStep()
        EmptyConsoleLogger is used - no calculations will be logged on ConsolePanel

      • BabyStepGiantStep

        public BabyStepGiantStep(ConsoleLogger logger)
        Custom ConsoleLogger is used to log calculations on ConsolePanel. If logger is null, then EmptyConsoleLogger will be used.
        Parameters:
        logger - ConsoleLogger

    • Method Detail

      • generateBabySteps

        private void generateBabySteps(java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger> babySteps,
                               java.math.BigInteger maxIteratorValue,
                               java.math.BigInteger modulus,
                               java.math.BigInteger result,
                               java.math.BigInteger logBase)
        Calculates baby steps, defined as: a(i) = x*g^i (mod p), where i=0,1...,maxIteratorValue and maxIteratorValue = ceil(sqrt(modulus))-1 p is modulus x is result g is logarithm base
        Parameters:
        babySteps - array into which calculated baby steps will be added
        maxIteratorValue - value used in for loop. It is defined as ceil(sqrt(modulus))-1
        modulus - modulus (p)
        result - result (x)
        logBase - logarithm base (g)

      • matchBabyStep

        private java.math.BigInteger matchBabyStep(java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger> babySteps,
                                           java.math.BigInteger maxIteratorValue,
                                           java.math.BigInteger giantStep)
        Method used to compare generated baby steps (using generateBabySteps(java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger>, java.math.BigInteger, java.math.BigInteger, java.math.BigInteger, java.math.BigInteger) with giant step.
        Parameters:
        giantStep - giant step defined as b(j) = g^(k*j) (mod p), created in calculate(java.math.BigInteger, java.math.BigInteger, java.math.BigInteger) for specific j.
        maxIteratorValue - value used in for loop. It is defined as ceil(sqrt(modulus))-1
        babySteps - list of baby steps defined as a(i) = x*g^i (mod p), where i=0,1...,maxIteratorValue
        Returns:
        -1 if match was not found, else i (position of matched element in baby steps array)

      • calculate

        public java.math.BigInteger calculate(java.math.BigInteger logBase,
                                      java.math.BigInteger modulus,
                                      java.math.BigInteger result)
                               throws MathException
        Implemented method from interface DiscreteLogarithm. Perform discrete logarithm calculation.
        Parameters:
        logBase - logarithm base (g)
        modulus - modulus (p)
        result - result(x)
        Returns:
        result of discrete logarithm problem calculation (a), which is log[g](x) = a (mod p).
        Throws:
        MathException - exception thrown on any calculation problem, i.e. solution not found, illegal argument etc.
